name: Interesting Culinary Tidbits Quiz | Food & Drink | 5 Questions

questions.text: Margaret Rudkin built which modern bakery in her horse stables?
questions.explanation:
Pepperidge Farms.

	Pepperidge Farms brands now include a number of staples, among them their famous cakes and cookies.

questions.text: What cooking school did Frances Roth and Katherine Angell open in Hyde Park, New York?
questions.explanation:
Culinary Institute of America.

	Culinary Institute of America boasts a number of famous graduates, including Anthony Bourdain, Anne Burrell, Michael Chiarello and Cat Cora.

questions.text: U.S. Army K-rations have included: Graham biscuits, canned meat, sugar, coffee, and which of these?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate.

	No one knows exactly what the 'K' in 'K-ration' stands for, but it could symbolize the last name of Professor Ancel Keyes, a food expert.

questions.text: What did Smirnoff Vodka promise Americans of alleviating in 1948?
questions.explanation:
Whiskey breath.

	The Smirnoff company was founded in Moscow in the 1860s.

questions.text: Who was the writer of 'Les Plaisirs de la Table' in the Paris newspaper "Le Monde"?
questions.explanation:
La Reyniere.

	Grimod de la Reyniere was a famous French gourmet of long ago (1758-1838)and in 1952 Courtine began to use his name as a pen name until 1993. Thank you for playing this quiz and bon appetit!
